name: NIST 800-53 Rev 5
description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for information systems and organizations to protect organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation from a diverse set of threats and risks.
source: National Institute of Standards and Technology

requirements.title: Access Control
requirements.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices and to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to exercise.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate access control policy and procedures.

children.title: Account Management
children.description: Define and document the types of accounts allowed and specifically prohibited for use within the system.

children.title: Access Enforcement
children.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources.

children.title: Information Flow Enforcement
children.description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between connected systems.

children.title: Separation of Duties
children.description: Identify and document duties of individuals requiring separation and define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

children.title: Least Privilege
children.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users which are necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.

children.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
children.description: Enforce a limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a specified time period.

children.title: System Use Notification
children.description: Display an approved system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system.

children.title: Previous Logon Notification
children.description: Notify the user, upon successful logon, of the date and time of the last logon.

children.title: Concurrent Session Control
children.description: Limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system account.

children.title: Device Lock
children.description: Prevent further access to the system by initiating a device lock after a specified period of inactivity.

children.title: Session Termination
children.description: Automatically terminate a user session after defined conditions or trigger events.

children.title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
children.description: Identify and document specific user actions that can be performed on the system without identification or authentication.

children.title: Remote Access
children.description: Establish and document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed.

children.title: Wireless Access
children.description: Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of wireless access.

children.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices
children.description: Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for organization-controlled mobile devices.

children.title: Use of External Systems
children.description: Establish terms and conditions for authorized individuals to access the system from external systems.

children.title: Information Sharing
children.description: Enable authorized users to determine whether access authorizations assigned to a sharing partner match the information's access and use restrictions.

children.title: Publicly Accessible Content
children.description: Designate individuals authorized to make information publicly accessible and review the proposed content of information prior to posting.

children.title: Access Control Decisions
children.description: Establish procedures to ensure access control decisions are applied to each access request prior to access enforcement.

children.title: Reference Monitor
children.description: Implement a reference monitor for access control to system resources that is tamperproof, always invoked, and small enough to be subject to analysis and testing.

requirements.title: Awareness and Training
requirements.description: Ensure that managers and users of organizational information systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities and of the applicable laws, policies, and procedures related to the security of those systems.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate literacy training and awareness policy and procedures.

children.title: Literacy Training and Awareness
children.description: Provide literacy training and awareness training to system users including measures to test the knowledge level of users.

children.title: Role-Based Training
children.description: Provide role-based security and privacy training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities.

children.title: Training Records
children.description: Document and monitor information security and privacy training activities including basic security and privacy awareness training.

children.title: Training Feedback
children.description: Provide feedback on organizational training results to relevant personnel on an ongoing basis.

requirements.title: Audit and Accountability
requirements.description: Create, protect, and retain information system audit records to the extent needed to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful, unauthorized, or inappropriate information system activity.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate audit and accountability policy and procedures.

children.title: Event Logging
children.description: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging in support of the audit function.

children.title: Content of Audit Records
children.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: what type of event occurred, when the event occurred, where the event occurred, the source of the event, the outcome of the event, and the identity of any individuals, subjects, or objects/entities associated with the event.

children.title: Audit Log Storage Capacity
children.description: Allocate audit log storage capacity to accommodate audit log retention requirements.

children.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
children.description: Alert designated personnel within a specified time period in the event of an audit logging process failure.

children.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
children.description: Review and analyze system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity and report findings.

children.title: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
children.description: Provide and implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability.

children.title: Time Stamps
children.description: Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records.

children.title: Protection of Audit Information
children.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

children.title: Non-repudiation
children.description: Provide irrefutable evidence that an individual or process authorized access and performed a function or action.

children.title: Audit Record Retention
children.description: Retain audit records for a specified time period to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of incidents.

children.title: Audit Record Generation
children.description: Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing.

children.title: Monitoring for Information Disclosure
children.description: Monitor open source information for evidence of unauthorized disclosure of organizational information.

children.title: Session Audit
children.description: Provide and implement the capability for authorized users to select a user session to capture and record.

children.title: Cross-Organizational Audit Logging
children.description: Employ organization-defined methods for coordinating audit information among external organizations.

requirements.title: Assessment, Authorization, and Monitoring
requirements.description: Periodically assess the security and privacy controls in organizational information systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy and procedures.

children.title: Control Assessments
children.description: Select the appropriate assessor or assessment team for the type of assessment to be conducted.

children.title: Information Exchange
children.description: Approve and manage the exchange of information between the system and other systems.

children.title: Plan of Action and Milestones
children.description: Develop a plan of action and milestones for the system to document the planned remediation actions.

children.title: Authorization
children.description: Assign a senior official as the authorizing official for the system.

children.title: Continuous Monitoring
children.description: Develop a system-level continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring.

children.title: Penetration Testing
children.description: Conduct penetration testing on defined systems or system components.

children.title: Internal System Connections
children.description: Authorize internal connections of system components or classes of components to the system.

requirements.title: Configuration Management
requirements.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational information systems throughout the respective system development life cycles.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate configuration management policy and procedures.

children.title: Baseline Configuration
children.description: Develop, document, and maintain a current baseline configuration of the system.

children.title: Configuration Change Control
children.description: Determine and document the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled.

children.title: Impact Analyses
children.description: Analyze changes to the system to determine potential security and privacy impacts prior to change implementation.

children.title: Access Restrictions for Change
children.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to the system.

children.title: Configuration Settings
children.description: Establish and document configuration settings for components employed within the system.

children.title: Least Functionality
children.description: Configure the system to provide only mission-essential capabilities.

children.title: System Component Inventory
children.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that accurately reflects the system.

children.title: Configuration Management Plan
children.description: Develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the system.

children.title: Software Usage Restrictions
children.description: Use software and associated documentation in accordance with contract agreements and copyright laws.

children.title: User-Installed Software
children.description: Establish policies governing the installation of software by users.

children.title: Information Location
children.description: Identify and document the location of system components storing information within the system.

children.title: Signed Components
children.description: Prevent the installation of software and firmware components without verification that the component has been digitally signed.

requirements.title: Contingency Planning
requirements.description: Establish, maintain, and effectively implement plans for emergency response, backup operations, and post-disaster recovery for organizational information systems.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate contingency planning policy and procedures.

children.title: Contingency Plan
children.description: Develop a contingency plan for the system that identifies essential mission and business functions.

children.title: Contingency Training
children.description: Provide contingency training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities.

children.title: Contingency Plan Testing
children.description: Test the contingency plan for the system to determine the effectiveness of the plan.

children.title: Alternate Storage Site
children.description: Establish an alternate storage site, including necessary agreements to permit the storage and retrieval of system backup information.

children.title: Alternate Processing Site
children.description: Establish an alternate processing site, including necessary agreements to permit the transfer and resumption of system operations.

children.title: Telecommunications Services
children.description: Establish alternate telecommunications services including necessary agreements to permit the resumption of system operations.

children.title: System Backup
children.description: Conduct backups of user-level information, system-level information, and system documentation.

children.title: System Recovery and Reconstitution
children.description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state within organization-defined time period after a disruption.

children.title: Alternate Communications Protocols
children.description: Provide the capability to employ alternative communications protocols to support maintaining continuity of operations.

children.title: Safe Mode
children.description: When organization-defined conditions are detected, enter a safe mode of operation with organization-defined restrictions of safe mode of operation.

children.title: Alternative Security Mechanisms
children.description: Employ alternative or supplemental security mechanisms for satisfying organization-defined security requirements.

requirements.title: Identification and Authentication
requirements.description: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices and authenticate the identities of those users, processes, or devices.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate identification and authentication policy and procedures.

children.title: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users)
children.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users and associate that unique identification with processes acting on behalf of those users.

children.title: Device Identification and Authentication
children.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate devices before establishing a connection.

children.title: Identifier Management
children.description: Manage system identifiers by receiving authorization from organizational personnel to assign an identifier.

children.title: Authenticator Management
children.description: Manage system authenticators by verifying, as part of the initial authenticator distribution, the identity of the individual, group, role, service, or device receiving the authenticator.

children.title: Authentication Feedback
children.description: Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation/use by unauthorized individuals.

children.title: Cryptographic Module Authentication
children.description: Implement mechanisms for authentication to a cryptographic module that meet applicable requirements.

children.title: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users)
children.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users or processes acting on behalf of non-organizational users.

children.title: Service Identification and Authentication
children.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate services before establishing communications with the service.

children.title: Adaptive Authentication
children.description: Require users to provide additional authentication factors when organization-defined circumstances require additional authentication.

children.title: Re-authentication
children.description: Require users to re-authenticate when organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring re-authentication occur.

children.title: Identity Proofing
children.description: Identity proof users that require accounts for logical access to systems based on appropriate identity assurance level requirements.

requirements.title: Incident Response
requirements.description: Establish an operational incident handling capability for organizational information systems that includes adequate preparation, detection, analysis, containment, recovery, and user response activities.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate incident response policy and procedures.

children.title: Incident Response Training
children.description: Provide incident response training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities.

children.title: Incident Response Testing
children.description: Test the effectiveness of the incident response capability.

children.title: Incident Handling
children.description: Implement an incident handling capability for incidents that is consistent with the incident response plan.

children.title: Incident Monitoring
children.description: Track and document incidents.

children.title: Incident Reporting
children.description: Require personnel to report suspected incidents to the organizational incident response capability within an organization-defined time period.

children.title: Incident Response Assistance
children.description: Provide an incident response support resource, integral to the organizational incident response capability.

children.title: Incident Response Plan
children.description: Develop an incident response plan that provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability.

children.title: Information Spillage Response
children.description: Respond to information spills by identifying the specific information involved in the system contamination.

children.title: Integrated Information Security Analysis Team
children.description: Establish an integrated team of forensic/malware analysts, tool developers, and operations personnel.

requirements.title: Maintenance
requirements.description: Perform periodic and timely maintenance on organizational information systems and provide effective controls on the tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct information system maintenance.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system maintenance policy and procedures.

children.title: Controlled Maintenance
children.description: Schedule, document, and review records of maintenance, repair, and replacement on system components.

children.title: Maintenance Tools
children.description: Approve, control, and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.

children.title: Nonlocal Maintenance
children.description: Approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities.

children.title: Maintenance Personnel
children.description: Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization and maintain a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.

children.title: Timely Maintenance
children.description: Obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for system components within an organization-defined time period of failure.

children.title: Field Maintenance
children.description: Restrict or prohibit field maintenance on organization-defined system components to organization-defined trusted maintenance facilities.

requirements.title: Media Protection
requirements.description: Protect information system media, both paper and digital; limit access to information on information system media to authorized users; and sanitize or destroy information system media before disposal or release for reuse.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate media protection policy and procedures.

children.title: Media Access
children.description: Restrict access to organization-defined types of digital and/or non-digital media to organization-defined personnel or roles.

children.title: Media Marking
children.description: Mark system media indicating the distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable security markings of the information.

children.title: Media Storage
children.description: Physically control and securely store organization-defined types of digital and/or non-digital media within organization-defined controlled areas.

children.title: Media Transport
children.description: Protect and control organization-defined types of system media during transport outside of controlled areas.

children.title: Media Sanitization
children.description: Sanitize system media prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse.

children.title: Media Use
children.description: Restrict the use of organization-defined types of system media on organization-defined systems or system components.

children.title: Media Downgrading
children.description: Establish organization-defined system media downgrading process that includes employing downgrading mechanisms.

requirements.title: Physical and Environmental Protection
requirements.description: Limit physical access to information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals; protect the physical plant and support infrastructure for information systems.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate physical and environmental protection policy and procedures.

children.title: Physical Access Authorizations
children.description: Develop, approve, and maintain a list of individuals with authorized access to the facility where the system resides.

children.title: Physical Access Control
children.description: Enforce physical access authorizations at organization-defined entry and exit points to the facility.

children.title: Access Control for Transmission
children.description: Control physical access to organization-defined system distribution and transmission lines within organizational facilities.

children.title: Access Control for Output Devices
children.description: Control physical access to output from organization-defined output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining the output.

children.title: Monitoring Physical Access
children.description: Monitor physical access to the facility where the system resides to detect and respond to physical security incidents.

children.title: Visitor Access Records
children.description: Maintain visitor access records to the facility where the system resides.

children.title: Power Equipment and Cabling
children.description: Protect power equipment and power cabling for the system from damage and destruction.

children.title: Emergency Shutoff
children.description: Provide the capability of shutting off power to organization-defined system or individual system components in emergency situations.

children.title: Emergency Power
children.description: Provide an uninterruptible power supply to facilitate orderly shutdown of the system in the event of a primary power source loss.

children.title: Emergency Lighting
children.description: Employ and maintain automatic emergency lighting for the system that activates in the event of a power outage or disruption.

children.title: Fire Protection
children.description: Employ and maintain fire detection and suppression systems that are supported by an independent energy source.

children.title: Environmental Controls
children.description: Maintain temperature and humidity levels within the facility where the system resides at organization-defined acceptable levels.

children.title: Water Damage Protection
children.description: Protect the system from damage resulting from water leakage by providing master shutoff or isolation valves.

children.title: Delivery and Removal
children.description: Authorize and control organization-defined types of system components entering and exiting the facility.

children.title: Alternate Work Site
children.description: Employ management, operational, and technical controls at alternate work sites equivalent to those at the primary site.

children.title: Location of System Components
children.description: Position system components within the facility to minimize potential damage from physical and environmental hazards.

children.title: Information Leakage
children.description: Protect the system from information leakage due to electromagnetic signals emanations.

children.title: Asset Monitoring and Tracking
children.description: Employ organization-defined asset location technologies to track and monitor the location and movement of organization-defined assets.

children.title: Electromagnetic Pulse Protection
children.description: Employ organization-defined protective measures against electromagnetic pulse damage for organization-defined systems and system components.

children.title: Component Marking
children.description: Mark organization-defined system hardware components indicating the impact or classification level of the information permitted to be processed, stored, or transmitted by the hardware component.

children.title: Facility Location
children.description: Plan the location or site of the facility where the system resides considering physical and environmental hazards.

requirements.title: Planning
requirements.description: Develop, document, periodically update, and implement security and privacy plans for organizational information systems that describe the security and privacy controls in place or planned.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate planning policy and procedures.

children.title: System Security and Privacy Plans
children.description: Develop security and privacy plans for the system that provide an overview of the security and privacy requirements for the system.

children.title: Rules of Behavior
children.description: Establish and provide to individuals requiring access to the system, the rules that describe their responsibilities and expected behavior for information and system usage.

children.title: Concept of Operations
children.description: Develop a Concept of Operations (CONOPS) for the system describing how the organization intends to operate the system.

children.title: Security and Privacy Architectures
children.description: Develop security and privacy architectures for the system that describe the requirements and approach to be taken.

children.title: Central Management
children.description: Centrally manage organization-defined controls and related processes.

children.title: Baseline Selection
children.description: Select a control baseline for the system.

children.title: Baseline Tailoring
children.description: Tailor the selected control baseline by applying specified tailoring actions.

requirements.title: Program Management
requirements.description: Implement an organization-wide information security program and provide oversight to ensure that the information security program is implemented, tested, and continuously monitored across the organization.

children.title: Information Security Program Plan
children.description: Develop and disseminate an organization-wide information security program plan.

children.title: Information Security Program Leadership Role
children.description: Appoint a senior agency information security officer with the mission and resources to coordinate, develop, implement, and maintain an organization-wide information security program.

children.title: Information Security and Privacy Resources
children.description: Include the resources needed to implement the information security and privacy programs in capital planning and investment requests.

children.title: Plan of Action and Milestones Process
children.description: Implement a process to ensure that plans of action and milestones for the information security, privacy, and supply chain risk management programs are developed and maintained.

children.title: System Inventory
children.description: Develop and maintain an inventory of organizational systems.

children.title: Measures of Performance
children.description: Develop, monitor, and report on the results of information security and privacy measures of performance.

children.title: Enterprise Architecture
children.description: Develop and maintain an enterprise architecture with consideration for information security, privacy, and the resulting risk to organizational operations.

children.title: Critical Infrastructure Plan
children.description: Address information security and privacy issues in the development, documentation, and updating of a critical infrastructure and key resources protection plan.

children.title: Risk Management Strategy
children.description: Develop a comprehensive strategy to manage risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, and other organizations.

children.title: Authorization Process
children.description: Manage the security and privacy state of organizational systems and the environments in which those systems operate through authorization processes.

children.title: Mission and Business Process Definition
children.description: Define organizational mission and business processes with consideration for information security and privacy and the resulting risk to organizational operations.

children.title: Insider Threat Program
children.description: Implement an insider threat program that includes a cross-discipline insider threat incident handling team.

children.title: Security and Privacy Workforce
children.description: Establish a security and privacy workforce development and improvement program.

children.title: Testing, Training, and Monitoring
children.description: Implement a process for ensuring that organizational plans for conducting security and privacy testing, training, and monitoring activities are developed and maintained.

children.title: Security and Privacy Groups and Associations
children.description: Establish and institutionalize contact with selected groups and associations within the security and privacy communities.

children.title: Threat Awareness Program
children.description: Implement a threat awareness program that includes a cross-organization information-sharing capability.

children.title: Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information on External Systems
children.description: Establish policy and procedures to ensure that requirements for the protection of controlled unclassified information are met.

children.title: Privacy Program Plan
children.description: Develop and disseminate an organization-wide privacy program plan.

children.title: Privacy Program Leadership Role
children.description: Appoint a senior agency official for privacy with the authority, mission, accountability, and resources to coordinate, develop, and implement, applicable privacy requirements.

children.title: Dissemination of Privacy Program Information
children.description: Maintain a central resource webpage to serve as the central source of information about the organization's privacy program.

children.title: Accounting of Disclosures
children.description: Develop and maintain an accurate accounting of disclosures of personally identifiable information.

children.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Management
children.description: Develop and document organization-wide policies and procedures for ensuring the quality of personally identifiable information.

children.title: Data Governance Body
children.description: Establish a Data Governance Body consisting of organization-defined roles with organization-defined responsibilities.

children.title: Data Integrity Board
children.description: Establish a Data Integrity Board to oversee organizational Computer Matching Agreements.

children.title: Minimization of Personally Identifiable Information Used in Testing, Training, and Research
children.description: Develop, document, and implement policies and procedures to address the use of personally identifiable information for internal testing, training, and research.

children.title: Complaint Management
children.description: Implement a process for receiving and responding to complaints, concerns, or questions from individuals.

children.title: Privacy Reporting
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate privacy reports to demonstrate organizational accountability with privacy program requirements.

children.title: Risk Framing
children.description: Identify the assumptions, constraints, risk tolerances, and priorities/trade-offs used within the organization for making investment and operational decisions.

children.title: Risk Management Program Leadership Roles
children.description: Appoint a Senior Accountable Official for Risk Management and establish a Risk Executive Council.

children.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Strategy
children.description: Develop an organization-wide strategy for managing supply chain risks associated with the development, acquisition, maintenance, and disposal of systems.

children.title: Continuous Monitoring Strategy
children.description: Develop an organization-wide continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring programs.

children.title: Purposing
children.description: Analyze organization-defined systems or system components supporting mission essential services to ensure that the resource is being used consistent with its intended purpose.

requirements.title: Personnel Security
requirements.description: Ensure that individuals occupying positions of responsibility within organizations are trustworthy and meet established security criteria for those positions.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate personnel security policy and procedures.

children.title: Position Risk Designation
children.description: Assign a risk designation to all organizational positions and establish screening criteria for individuals filling those positions.

children.title: Personnel Screening
children.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to the system.

children.title: Personnel Termination
children.description: Upon termination of individual employment, disable system access within an organization-defined time period.

children.title: Personnel Transfer
children.description: Review and confirm ongoing operational need for current logical and physical access authorizations when individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions within the organization.

children.title: Access Agreements
children.description: Develop and document access agreements for organizational systems.

children.title: External Personnel Security
children.description: Establish personnel security requirements, including security roles and responsibilities for external providers.

children.title: Personnel Sanctions
children.description: Employ a formal sanctions process for individuals failing to comply with established information security and privacy policies and procedures.

children.title: Position Descriptions
children.description: Incorporate security and privacy roles and responsibilities into organizational position descriptions.

requirements.title: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
requirements.description: Apply the NIST Privacy Framework and associated controls to personally identifiable information processing.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate personally identifiable information processing and transparency policy and procedures.

children.title: Authority to Process Personally Identifiable Information
children.description: Determine and document the legal authority that permits the processing of personally identifiable information.

children.title: Personally Identifiable Information Processing Purposes
children.description: Identify and document the purposes for processing personally identifiable information.

children.title: Consent
children.description: Implement mechanisms to obtain consent for the processing of personally identifiable information prior to its collection.

children.title: Privacy Notice
children.description: Provide notice to individuals about the processing of personally identifiable information.

children.title: System of Records Notice
children.description: For systems that process information that will be maintained in a Privacy Act system of records, provide public notice.

children.title: Specific Categories of Personally Identifiable Information
children.description: Apply organization-defined processing conditions for specific categories of personally identifiable information.

children.title: Computer Matching Requirements
children.description: When a system or organization processes information for the purpose of conducting a matching program, verify that the requirements have been met.

requirements.title: Risk Assessment
requirements.description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals, resulting from the operation of organizational information systems and the associated processing, storage, or transmission of organizational information.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate risk assessment policy and procedures.

children.title: Security Categorization
children.description: Categorize the system and information it processes, stores, and transmits.

children.title: Risk Assessment
children.description: Conduct a risk assessment, including identifying threats to and vulnerabilities in the system.

children.title: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
children.description: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications.

children.title: Technical Surveillance Countermeasures Survey
children.description: Employ a technical surveillance countermeasures survey at organization-defined locations.

children.title: Risk Response
children.description: Respond to findings from security and privacy assessments, monitoring, and audits.

children.title: Privacy Impact Assessments
children.description: Conduct privacy impact assessments for systems, programs, or other activities before developing or procuring information technology.

children.title: Criticality Analysis
children.description: Identify critical system components and functions by performing a criticality analysis.

children.title: Threat Hunting
children.description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to search for indicators of compromise.

requirements.title: System and Services Acquisition
requirements.description: Allocate sufficient resources to adequately protect organizational information systems; employ system development life cycle processes that incorporate information security and privacy considerations.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system and services acquisition policy and procedures.

children.title: Allocation of Resources
children.description: Determine the high-level information security and privacy requirements for the system.

children.title: System Development Life Cycle
children.description: Acquire, develop, and manage the system using a system development life cycle methodology.

children.title: Acquisition Process
children.description: Include requirements for the system, system component, or system service in the acquisition contract.

children.title: System Documentation
children.description: Obtain or develop administrator documentation for the system that describes secure configuration and operation of the system.

children.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles
children.description: Apply security and privacy engineering principles in the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification of the system.

children.title: External System Services
children.description: Require that providers of external system services comply with organizational security and privacy requirements.

children.title: Developer Configuration Management
children.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform configuration management during design, development, implementation, and operation.

children.title: Developer Testing and Evaluation
children.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to develop and implement a plan for ongoing security and privacy assessments.

children.title: Development Process, Standards, and Tools
children.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to follow a documented development process.

children.title: Developer-Provided Training
children.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide organization-defined training on the correct use and operation of the implemented security and privacy functions.

children.title: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design
children.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to produce a design specification and security and privacy architecture.

children.title: Customized Development of Critical Components
children.description: Reimplement or custom develop organization-defined critical system components.

children.title: Developer Screening
children.description: Require that the developer of organization-defined system, system component, or system service have appropriate access authorizations.

children.title: Unsupported System Components
children.description: Replace system components when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer.

children.title: Specialization
children.description: Employ organization-defined specialization techniques when instantiating systems, system components, or system services.

requirements.title: System and Communications Protection
requirements.description: Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of information systems; and employ architectural designs, software development techniques, and systems engineering principles that promote effective information security.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system and communications protection policy and procedures.

children.title: Separation of System and User Functionality
children.description: Separate user functionality, including user interface services, from system management functionality.

children.title: Security Function Isolation
children.description: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

children.title: Information in Shared System Resources
children.description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

children.title: Denial-of-Service Protection
children.description: Protect against or limit the effects of denial-of-service attacks.

children.title: Boundary Protection
children.description: Monitor and control communications at the external managed interfaces to the system.

children.title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
children.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.

children.title: Network Disconnect
children.description: Terminate the network connection associated with a communications session at the end of the session or after a period of inactivity.

children.title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management
children.description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys when cryptography is employed within the system.

children.title: Cryptographic Protection
children.description: Implement organization-defined cryptographic uses and types of cryptography required for each specified cryptographic use.

children.title: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications
children.description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications.

children.title: Public Key Infrastructure Certificates
children.description: Issue public key certificates under an organization-defined certificate policy or obtain public key certificates from an approved service provider.

children.title: Mobile Code
children.description: Define acceptable and unacceptable mobile code and mobile code technologies.

children.title: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source)
children.description: Provide additional data origin and integrity verification artifacts along with the authoritative name resolution data.

children.title: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
children.description: Request and perform data origin authentication and data integrity verification on the name/address resolution responses.

children.title: Architecture and Provisioning for Name/Address Resolution Service
children.description: Ensure the systems that collectively provide name/address resolution service for an organization are fault-tolerant and implement internal and external role separation.

children.title: Session Authenticity
children.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

children.title: Fail in Known State
children.description: Fail to a secure state in the event of failures.

children.title: Protection of Information at Rest
children.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of information at rest.

children.title: Process Isolation
children.description: Maintain a separate execution domain for each executing system process.

children.title: System Time Synchronization
children.description: Synchronize system clocks within and between systems and system components.

requirements.title: System and Information Integrity
requirements.description: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner; provide protection from malicious code at appropriate locations within organizational information systems; and monitor information system security alerts and advisories and take appropriate actions in response.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate system and information integrity policy and procedures.

children.title: Flaw Remediation
children.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws.

children.title: Malicious Code Protection
children.description: Implement malicious code protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points.

children.title: System Monitoring
children.description: Monitor the system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks.

children.title: Security Alerts, Advisories, and Directives
children.description: Receive system security alerts, advisories, and directives from external organizations on an ongoing basis.

children.title: Security and Privacy Function Verification
children.description: Verify the correct operation of security and privacy functions.

children.title: Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity
children.description: Employ integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information.

children.title: Spam Protection
children.description: Employ spam protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points.

children.title: Information Input Validation
children.description: Check the validity of information inputs.

children.title: Error Handling
children.description: Generate error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing information that could be exploited.

children.title: Information Management and Retention
children.description: Manage and retain information within the system and information output from the system.

children.title: Predictable Failure Prevention
children.description: Determine mean time to failure for organization-defined system components.

children.title: Non-Persistence
children.description: Implement non-persistent system components and services that are initiated in a known state and terminated.

children.title: Information Output Filtering
children.description: Validate information output from software programs and/or applications to ensure that the information is consistent with the expected content.

children.title: Memory Protection
children.description: Implement organization-defined controls to protect the system memory from unauthorized code execution.

children.title: Fail-Safe Procedures
children.description: Implement organization-defined fail-safe procedures when organization-defined failure conditions occur.

children.title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Operations
children.description: Check the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, and completeness of personally identifiable information.

children.title: De-Identification
children.description: Remove personally identifiable information from datasets contained in the system prior to release or use.

children.title: Tainting
children.description: Embed data or capabilities in systems or system components to determine if organizational data has been exfiltrated.

children.title: Information Refresh
children.description: Refresh organization-defined information at organization-defined frequencies.

children.title: Information Diversity
children.description: Employ different information sources when processing organization-defined essential information.

children.title: Information Fragmentation
children.description: Based on organization-defined circumstances, fragment organization-defined information.

requirements.title: Supply Chain Risk Management
requirements.description: Develop, document, and implement a supply chain risk management plan that identifies organization-defined supply chain risk management controls.

children.title: Policy and Procedures
children.description: Develop, document, and disseminate supply chain risk management policy and procedures.

children.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan
children.description: Develop a plan for managing supply chain risks associated with the research and development, design, manufacturing, acquisition, delivery, integration, operations and maintenance, and disposal of systems, system components, or system services.

children.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes
children.description: Establish a process or processes to identify and address weaknesses or deficiencies in the supply chain elements and processes.

children.title: Provenance
children.description: Document, monitor, and maintain valid provenance of organization-defined systems, system components, and associated data.

children.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods
children.description: Employ organization-defined acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods.

children.title: Supplier Assessments and Reviews
children.description: Assess and review the supply chain-related risks associated with suppliers or contractors and the system, system component, or system service they provide.

children.title: Supply Chain Operations Security
children.description: Employ organization-defined Operations Security controls and safeguards to protect supply chain-related information for the system, system component, or system service.

children.title: Notification Agreements
children.description: Establish agreements and procedures with entities involved in the supply chain for the system, system component, or system service for the notification of supply chain compromises.

children.title: Tamper Resistance and Detection
children.description: Implement a tamper protection program for the system, system component, or system service.

children.title: Inspection of Systems or Components
children.description: Inspect organization-defined systems or system components to detect tampering.

children.title: Component Authenticity
children.description: Develop and implement anti-counterfeit policy and procedures that include the means to detect and prevent counterfeit components from entering the system.

children.title: Component Disposal
children.description: Dispose of organization-defined data, documentation, tools, or system components using organization-defined techniques and methods.
